content.question: The object is stopped and returned to equilibrium. The block is then pulled to the right to a position of <math alttext="x equals 2 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and released from rest. Which of the following indicates how the maximum speed obtained by the object changes and explains why?

choices.label: The maximum speed decreases by half because the maximum speed is inversely proportional to the amplitude.

The maximum speed decreases by a factor of <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the maximum speed is inversely proportional to the square of the amplitude.

The maximum speed increases by a factor of <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> because the maximum speed is proportional to the amplitude squared.
The maximum speed doubles because the maximum speed is proportional to the amplitude.
The maximum speed doubles because the total mechanical energy of the system is doubled.

content.answer: The maximum speed doubles because the maximum speed is proportional to the amplitude.
